title: 114_hr1963
content: The "Federal Leadership in Energy Efficient Transportation Act of 2015" or the "FLEET Act of 2015" aims to upgrade the vehicle fleet of the United States Postal Service to improve mail delivery services, reduce costs, and enhance fuel economy and emissions standards. It also allows the Postal Service to enter into energy savings performance contracts. Section 804(4) of the National Energy Conservation Policy Act is amended to include provisions for the United States Postal Service to purchase or lease low emission and fuel-efficient vehicles, as well as upgrade existing vehicles to increase fuel economy and reduce carbon dioxide emissions. The National Energy Conservation Policy Act is amended to include provisions for the United States Postal Service to purchase or lease low emission vehicles and upgrade infrastructure to support electric vehicles. SEC. 4 amends the National Energy Conservation Policy Act to include measures supporting low emission vehicles for the United States Postal Service. SEC. 5 focuses on upgrading the postal fleet. The Postmaster General must adhere to motor vehicle standards when awarding contracts or purchasing vehicles for the Postal Service, including emissions and fuel economy requirements. The Postmaster General must follow strict motor vehicle standards for Postal Service contracts, including emissions and fuel economy requirements. Light trucks must meet stringent carbon dioxide emission standards set by the EPA or achieve a minimum of 37.8 miles per gallon for fuel economy. The vehicle must comply with emissions standards for carbon dioxide and fuel economy requirements, including achieving at least 28.8 miles per gallon. The Postal Service must adhere to emissions standards for carbon dioxide and fuel economy set by the EPA and NHTSA. These standards apply to contracted vehicles and those purchased or leased after one year from the enactment of the Act. The Postmaster General is required to reduce the total consumption of petroleum products. The Postmaster General must reduce petroleum consumption by 2% annually in the Postal fleet until 2026. A cost-benefit analysis will determine if replacing vehicles is more beneficial. Routes will be reviewed to prioritize purchases of vehicles with better fuel economy or lower emissions. The Postmaster General must submit a report to Congress containing a plan to increase fuel economy and reduce emissions for Postal vehicles. Annual reports on progress and changes to routes or vehicle purchase strategies must also be provided. The Postmaster General is restricted from reducing mail delivery frequency to less than 6 days a week, closing post offices or distribution facilities, impacting collective bargaining agreements or employee benefits, and outsourcing duties to private companies. SEC. 6. DEFINITIONS. In this Act, definitions for terms like "contracted vehicle," "motor vehicle," "Postal delivery route," and "Postal fleet" are provided. The curr_chunk defines a "Postal Service" as the United States Postal Service and a "vehicle" as any vehicle owned, operated, leased, or assigned to the Postal Service.
